column4: a broken kernel aint fun, don't you have the old kernel left in grub?
grub still gives me the option to boot to it and it will try to boot but it will panic along the way when it tries to load video drivers
if you know what you changed you could boot from a CD and, well, unchange it :)
yes, there is, the installer will ask what partitions to hoose and which to keep (if you feel unsure when it asks you to confirm, ask in here)
